title: Telegram/Discord Tracking: Social Graph Leaks in Swaps
quickSteps: Separate personas: keep your swap/storage identity away from your public chat and points-farming identity.
Use a dedicated campaign wallet for quests, bots, referrals, and role-gated servers; never bridge it to serious funds.
Treat tracked links as attribution tools: avoid reusing the same UTM/referral URL across accounts, sessions, or wallets.
Reduce click-path correlation: avoid in-app browsing for sensitive actions and minimize session overlap between chats and swaps.
Stop screenshot leaks: share minimal context in support chats, crop aggressively, and avoid posting full timelines or identifiers.

seo.keywords: social graph leaks, Telegram bots, Discord verification, UTM tracking, referral links, wallet correlation, points farming privacy, no-kyc swaps, anonymous swaps
seo.description: How Telegram/Discord bots, UTMs, and referrals build a social graph around your swapsâ€”and how to stay active in crypto chats without linking your wallets.
